clinical_study.brief_title: Pilot Study for Zoledronic Acid to Prevent Bone Loss After RYGB
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study for Zoledronic Acid to Prevent High-Turnover Bone Loss After Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates whether zoledronic acid can prevent the high bone turnover that occurs after Roux-en-Y Gastric Bypass (RYGB) surgery.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators are evaluating the ability of a single dose of zoledronic acid given before RYGB to improve bone outcomes after surgery. The investigators have previously shown that RYGB has negative effects on skeletal health. The purpose of this study is to prevent the bone loss that occurs in adults who have chosen to undergo RYGB. Subjects will be randomized to receive either zoledronic acid or placebo.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Half of the participants will receive zoledronic acid and half of the participants will receive placebo
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: The Data Safety Monitoring Board will be unmasked, but all other parties involved will be masked to treatment arm.

primary_outcome.description: The primary aim of this study is to determine the postoperative changes in serum markers of bone turnover after a preoperative infusion of zoledronic acid versus placebo. Serum C-terminal telopeptide of type 1 collagen (CTX) is marker of bone resorption.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in bone mineral density by DXA
secondary_outcome.description: Early changes in areal bone mineral density will be measured at the hip and spine by Dual-energy X-ray Absorptiometry (DXA).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in bone mineral density by QCT
secondary_outcome.description: Early changes in volumetric bone mineral density will be measured at the spine by Quantitative Computed Tomography (QCT).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events as assessed by CTCAE v4.0
secondary_outcome.description: Hypocalcemia, if detected, will be graded according to common terminology for adverse event criteria (CTCAE v.4).

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive zoledronic acid (5mg), administered as an intravenous infusion.
Subjects will receive sterile free water for injection, administered as an intravenous infusion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men must be age ≥ 50
- Women must be postmenopausal
- Planning to receive RYGB surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 21
- Prior bariatric surgery
- Weight ≥ 400 lbs
- Liver or renal disease
- Hypercalcemia, hypocalcemia, or hypomagnesemia
- Serum 25-OH vitamin D < 20 ng/mL
- History of bone-modifying disorders
- Use of bone-active medications
- Known sensitivity to bisphosphonates
- Extensive dental work involving extraction or dental implant within the past 2 months or planned in the upcoming 6 months
